messages.title: SHOP BOSSES SLAM RISE IN 'JOBS TAX'
messages.content: Many of Britain's biggest retail companies have slammed Government plans to increase National Insurance as a tax on jobs. The plan will see anyone who employs staff facing increases in their payroll costs, at a time when many are struggling to cope with the recession.

messages.title: Councilâ€™s A-board U-turn after shops protest
messages.content: There was some good news last month as Wirral Council scrapped plans to charge shops to have an 'A board' on the pavement.

messages.title: New blow to Wirral shops as Government raises rates bill
messages.content: The Government has refused to think again on big rises in the tax paid by Wallasey's shops and small businesses.

messages.title: ANGER AS COUNCIL REPORT SAYS 'BIRKENHEAD FIRST'
messages.content: Shops in Wallasey and Moreton set to lose out.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: BUSINESS RATES: Are you getting some relief?
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Business rates are universally unpopular with small shops and businesses.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: MAKING APPRENTICESHIPS WORK BETTER FOR SMALL BUSINESS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Conservatives have been announced to make it easier for businesses to recruit apprentices, including direct payments to employers, simplify the recruitment process and reducing the amount of paperwork involved.

issues.economy: Many of Britain's biggest retail companies have slammed Government plans to increase National Insurance as a tax on jobs.
issues.governance: ANGER AS COUNCIL REPORT SAYS 'BIRKENHEAD FIRST'
